# fabric_workspace_outbound_gateway_rules (Data Source)

The Workspace Outbound Gateway Rules data-source allows you to retrieve details about a Fabric [Workspace Outbound Gateway Rules](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/security/workspace-outbound-access-protection-overview).

-> This data-source supports Service Principal authentication.

~> This data-source is in **preview**. To access it, you must explicitly enable the `preview` mode in the provider level configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "fabric_workspace_outbound_gateway_rules" "example" {
  workspace_id = "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `workspace_id` (String) The Workspace ID.

### Optional

- `timeouts` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--timeouts))

### Read-Only

- `allowed_gateways` (Attributes List) A list of rules that define outbound access behavior for gateways. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--allowed_gateways))
- `default_action` (String) Defines the default behavior for all gateways that are not explicitly listed in the allowed list array. If set to "Allow", all unspecified gateways are permitted by default. If set to "Deny", all unspecified gateways are blocked. Value must be one of : `Allow`, `Deny`.
- `id` (String) The Workspace Outbound Gateway Rules ID.

<a id="nestedatt--timeouts"></a>

### Nested Schema for `timeouts`

Optional:

- `read` (String) A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

<a id="nestedatt--allowed_gateways"></a>

### Nested Schema for `allowed_gateways`

Read-Only:

- `id` (String) Gateway Id to be allowed.
